body:
Happened again, this time with more descriptive error in the log:

```
[7679:0924/215344:ERROR:context_group.cc(193)] ContextGroup::Initialize failed because too few texture units.
[7679:0924/215344:ERROR:gles2_cmd_decoder.cc(2355)] GpuScheduler::InitializeCommon failed because group failed to initialize.
[7637:0924/215344:ERROR:command_buffer_proxy_impl.cc(158)] Failed to initialize command buffer service.
```

Looks like some gpu issue, maybe a memory leak in the render code?

Seems to be [related](https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=250487) [to](https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=65291) [WebGL](https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=189109). Does Atom use WebGL for rendering?

Ok found the error. It's a problem with [test-status](https://github.com/tombell/test-status/issues/44).
If it reoccurs under different circumstances I'll open another issue.
